ARABIC: وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا۟ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا إِنَّمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do not sell Allah's contract for a paltry price. What is with Allah is better for you if you only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And do not trade God's covenant for a paltry price. Remember, what is with God is better for you, if only you knew!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Do not barter away the covenant of Allah for a paltry gain. Verily that which is with Allah is far better for you, if you only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do not sell your covenant with God for a small price. The reward which you will receive from God is better for you, if only you knew it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah to procure an abject price; that which is with Allah is better for you, if you know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And do not use an oath by Allah for the purchase of little value, what is with Allah is better for you if you only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And do not take a small price in exchange for Allah's covenant; surely what is with Allah is better for you, did you but know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And do not sell the covenant of God for a small price; surely what is with God -- that is better for you, did you but know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And purchase not a small gain at the price of Allah's covenant. Lo! that which Allah hath is better for you, if ye did but know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do not sell God's covenant for a paltry price. What is with God is better for you if you only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And barter not the covenant of Allah for a small price; verily that which is with Allah --that is better for you, if ye only know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do not sell Allah’s covenants for a paltry gain. Indeed, what is with Allah is better for you, should you know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor sell the covenant of Allah for a miserable price: for with Allah is (a prize) far better for you, if ye only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And purchase not a small gain at the cost of Allah's Covenant. Verily! What is with Allah is better for you if you did but know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do not sell the covenant of Allah for a trifling price. What is with Allah is better for you if you but knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And do not exchange God’s covenant for a small price. What is with God is better for you, if you only knew.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:95] And do not sell God’s covenant for a small price, of this world, so that you break it in return for this [small price]. For truly what is with God, of reward, is better for you, than all that is in this world — if you should know, this, then do not break it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 293 (And purchase not a small gain at the price of Allah's covenant) i.e. swearing by Allah falsely to obtain a small worldly gain. (Lo! that which Allah hath) of reward (is better for you) than what you have of wealth, (if ye did but know) the reward of Allah; it is also said that this means: if you believe in the reward of Allah.
